item.title: Upcoming Game Looks Like Minecraft Meets Stardew Valley, and the Devs Want It on Xbox Game Pass
item.description:
Highlights

  • Cyberware's upcoming game Solarpunk merges survival gameplay with floating islands in a futuristic world, emphasizing renewable energy sources.
  • Fans are rallying for an Xbox Game Pass version of Solarpunk, showing support on social media for inclusion in the digital subscription service.
  • With Cyberware's previous successes on Steam, the chances of Solarpunk making it to Xbox seem favorable, adding to Game Pass's diverse lineup.

Last year, the reveal trailer for Solarpunk flew quietly under the radar, but fans have caught wind of this Minecraft -meets- Stardew-Valley fusion. From this newfound attention comes the demand for Solarpunk to feature on Xbox Game Pass.

Published by Rokaplay and developed by Cyberware, Solarpunk is a survival game set in a futuristic world full of floating islands. Players can gather materials, grow crops, build gadgets, and explore other areas in an airship. Elemental advantages like sunlight, wind, and rain can be used to craft an energy-efficient system for watering plants and mining resources. Solarpunk will act as German developer Cyberwave's first solo project, having previously co-developed Balloon Flight , Sloth Simulator , and Hourglass . The game is confirmed to be coming to Steam, but the fate of Solarpunk 's console release seems to be in the hands of the fans.

The Community Demands An Xbox Edition of Solarpunk

On May 31, the team behind Solarpunk asked the community if an Xbox Game Pass version of the game would be a worthwhile investment. Over on Twitter, the developers reached out directly to Xbox to request a one-on-one meeting with Phil Spencer, the Founder and CEO of Microsoft Gaming.

Only time will tell if Solarpunk earns an Xbox release, but the odds are good. Cyberware's other titles have received positive reviews on Steam, particularly Hourglass , a puzzle-solving game set in Ancient Egypt. Players control Aywa, an adventurer navigating Egypt in search of her missing father, a respected archaeologist. Solarpunk will maintain Cyberware's constant theme of advanced technology, but instead mimic the mechanics of other popular "cozy" games such as Stardew Valley .

Although Cyberware borrowed the term to title its latest release, "solarpunk" refers to a subgenre pertaining to the progression of technology alongside the natural environment. Some examples include Synergy , Astroneer , Cities: Skylines , and the Anno game series.

Solarpunk could join several other favorites in the Xbox Game Pass Catalog, featuring many games showcasing LGBTQIA+ creators this Pride Month, namely The Quarry , Starfield , Celeste , Unpacking , Assassin's Creed Valhalla , and many more. Game Pass constantly adds and removes titles, so there's always a fresh selection of games to choose from. With any amount of luck, Solarpunk may just appear in one of this year's cycles.

An official release date has yet to be confirmed, but the Solarpunk team are appealing to Microsoft in the pursuit of an Xbox release, so it may be sooner rather than later.

item.title: Final Fantasy 14: Inside Rehearsals for Digital Theater
item.description:
Virtual theater is a growing field in online games, and nowhere is this more true than in Final Fantasy 14 . From Curtain Call Theater to A Stage Reborn, the culture of virtual theater is practically legendary. Of course, it isn’t limited to Final Fantasy , with Fallout 76 hosting the Wasteland Theatre Company among others too.

Final Fantasy 14 players have established a fleshed-out community of sporting events, community festivals, museums, and more. That includes a theatrical community spanning many companies of performers. Game Rant recently spoke to several experts from Final Fantasy 14 ’s theatrical community, including Stanzek Rosyasch and Soso, about how these companies prepare and rehearse, as well as adapt stories from the real world to the setting of Etheirys.

How to Rehearse in Virtual Theater

Recently, Final Fantasy 14 ’s Firebird Theater staged a production of the Sherlock Holmes classic A Scandal in Bohemia (which was localized for Etheirys as A Scandal in Aldenard ), where Stanzek Rosyasch played the part of Watson. Rosyasch talked to Game Rant as part of a virtual theater roundtable, discussing the way they prepared for the role.

We join in voice chat to hear calls and instructions. It also helps with communication between actors. “Sorry, I was late on that!” Helps everyone understand that the action you just did is an anomaly and won’t normally be that delayed. It’s generally very quiet, out of respect for everyone’s focus, but that doesn’t mean we are all super serious all the time! There are days when the giggles strike everyone and we embrace it. Little mistakes become inside jokes, sometimes we intentionally do non-disruptive things.

That sense of fun can be helpful to ease the pressure of rehearsals, which can be strictly regimented experiences. For Rosyasch, rehearsals were held on Saturdays, Sundays, and Mondays in the afternoon and early evening. Part of balancing the focus and work of production with the fun of the craft, though, was grouping scenes to be performed in a way that may not be the order scenes are performed on stage to allow some actors nights off here or there, he explained. Another example of adding a bit of fun to the whole process that Rosyasch gave was when he asked what the dress rehearsals would entail. Someone quipped that it meant wearing a dress, so when the day came around, all the actors showed up in the same dress.

As for what rehearsals entail, the nature of them is obviously different from flesh-and-blood performances. While some things are less intensive, others are far harder. A major challenge in Final Fantasy 14 in particular is cues and timing. Where in real-world performances cues are often something that can be logically understood and there’s a certain element of natural movement involved in timing, performances in Etheirys require the timing precision of intense choreography without some of the natural and logical indicators that can make those easy to remember. This is because these digital plays rely on the macro tools present in Final Fantasy 14.

​​​​​​

Much Ado About Macros

Macros allow players to coordinate actions, lines of dialogue, emotes, and more. In order for them to work with multiple people, like in a real-world play, the timing becomes a tightrope. Without precision timing, the lack of synchronization of the macros grows worse until it's time for the next macro. As Soso explained, macros are one of the most important tools for performers in the game.

Soso explained that where the average player may use a macro to link two actions together, like Swiftcast and Resurrection, but macro performers will use it to sync lines with emotes or actions. Virtual theater takes the macro performer’s use of the tool to the next level.

Each macro can only have 15 lines. Of those 15 lines, at least half of those lines need to be used for emotes. On top of that, an actor may also need to use some of those macro lines for initiating a countdown so that actions properly line up on the stage, be used for an echo to help the actor remember what their blocking is or when they're supposed to do a certain action outside their macros (like if they need to move and then take a seat), or to use even more emotes because an expression emote is needed to change the feel of an emote.

That means, in a full play, there will often be dozens of macros needed for the FF14 performance. That, too, can be an issue if people have macros set aside for HUD features or other conveniences. Players only have access to 200 macro slots, so it's important real estate for actors in Final Fantasy 14 . That’s primarily an issue for actors, but Soso stressed that accommodating the limits of the macro system is also on the scriptwriters.

At the end of the day, rehearsals are about getting a show ready for an audience, and while no two look alike in real-world or digital theater, FF14 rehearsals relish in the livelihood, technical know-how, and craft of all those involved.

item.title: Rumored Xbox Handheld Console May Be Closer Than Expected
item.description:
Highlights

  • Microsoft will reportedly tease an Xbox handheld console at the June 9 Xbox Games Showcase.
  • While an Xbox handheld console has been rumored for a while now, all past reports on the matter suggested that it won't be out before the next console generation, circa 2028.
  • The possibility of a mid-2024 teaser casts some major doubts on that purported release timeline.

Microsoft is planning to confirm the existence of an Xbox handheld console in June 2024, an established leaker has said. The claim suggests that the much-rumored Xbox device could be significantly closer to hitting the market than initially expected.

Xbox handheld rumors have been circulating online for a while now, with the most recent wave of such reports dating back to early 2024. But all insider accounts asserting that a portable Xbox device is in the works have labeled it as part of the next, tenth generation of gaming consoles. Microsoft itself doesn't expect that console generation to arrive before 2028, according to some chat log transcripts between its executives that surfaced in the discovery phase of the company's recent legal battle with the FTC over the Activision Blizzard deal.

Next Xbox Games Showcase Rumored to Include Handheld Console Teaser

Spanish leaker eXtas1s has now cast some major doubts on that release timeline, asserting that Microsoft will confirm its first portable console's existence as early as this month. Specifically, the company is planning to tease the handheld device at the June 9 Xbox Games Showcase, eXtas1s said in a late May YouTube video. The plan is to offer just a "small" teaser, the leaker claimed, citing unnamed sources familiar with the matter.

Even if the upcoming showcase doesn't deliver a full reveal of the device, the rumor itself suggests that Microsoft's first handheld may not be part of the next-gen Xbox lineup. Since the upcoming console generation is still estimated to be at least four years away, sharing any kind of hardware teasers—no matter how small—would be an entirely unprecedented move for Microsoft to make. It hence appears plausible that if eXtas1s's information is accurate and such a glimpse of an Xbox handheld device does arrive come June 9, whatever it ends up showing will likely be ready to hit the market way before the next generation of consoles does circa 2028.

Microsoft Gaming CEO Phil Spencer has himself recently stoked Xbox handheld console rumors on social media. Several early 2024 reports have also suggested that the tech giant is currently in the process of transitioning to an "every screen is an Xbox" gaming strategy. A portable console would align with that purported approach.

Microsoft May Shadow-Drop a New First-Party Game at the Xbox Games Showcase

Aside from this blockbuster handheld claim, eXtas1s has recently also shared some additional insights into the June 2024 Xbox Games Showcase. Among other things, the leaker reported that Microsoft plans to shadow-drop a first-party game that has already been announced as part of the event. Obsidian Entertainment's Avowed and Stoic Studio's Towerborne both fit that description, especially since both are currently targeting a 2024 launch but neither has committed to a firm release date. The leaker also estimated that the June 9 showcase will see Microsoft share around a dozen first-party game trailers in total.

item.title: June 25 is Going to Be a Big Day for Lethal Company
item.description:
Highlights

  • Version 55 of Lethal Company, set for release by June 25, promises huge updates after the success of the massive Version 50.
  • Zeekerss, the mastermind behind Lethal Company, continues to impress fans with constant updates and surprises.
  • The new collaboration with Fortnite showcases how smaller games like Lethal Company can still make a big impact.

Lethal Company creator Zeekerss announced the highly anticipated Version 55 is scheduled for release on June 25 or sooner. Two months have elapsed since Lethal Company 's last major release, with Version 50 widely regarded as the biggest patch for the game throughout its entire lifetime. Since then, fans have been eagerly anticipating what the developer might have in store for the next big content update, and how Zeekerss planned to further evolve the hit horror co-op title's formula after implementing such massive changes.

The viral success of Lethal Company in the weeks following its 2023 launch was made all the more remarkable when considering the fact that it was created by a single former Roblox game creator, whose game even went on to inspire a surprisingly engaging April Fools parody. As the sole developer and publisher for Lethal Company , Zeekerss has additionally continued to pump out update after update, culminating in the biggest patch to release in the game's history on Lethal Company 's half-year anniversary back in April. Even after the addition of several new moons and entities, the developer is still working on more content, though as always, he has remained tight-lipped regarding what he has in store.

Luckily, fans of the hit co-op horror game won't have to wait much longer to experience it for themselves, as Zeekerss shared a video on his official YouTube channel announcing that Version 55 will go live by June 25 at the latest. Apart from the release date, the video additionally gives fans a glimpse into one of the biggest features planned in the next major update with gameplay footage of the Company Cruiser, a red van that is releasing with Version 55.

Fortnite Announces Lethal Company Crossover

Version 55 isn't the only big event for Lethal Company in June either. The horror co-op game is also collaborating with Epic Games' massively popular battle royale shooter Fortnite . The Fortnite and Lethal Company crossover featured the addition of several cosmetics inspired by Zeekerss' beloved title, including a character skin, pickaxe skin, back bling, and an emote. Interested players can purchase each cosmetic from Fortnite 's Item Shop individually or buy the whole set for a discounted 2,100 V-Bucks.

Lethal Company stands as a testament to the potential of modern-day developers and is also proof that a big budget and a major publisher are not inherently required to create a hit game. In this day of quadruple-A titles and multi-million dollar budgets, gamers can rest assured that smaller video game studios are still important and can continue to thrive in the industry.

item.title: OutRage's Fortnite and Tekken Roots Explained
item.description:
Highlights

  • OutRage: Fight Fest combines brawler and battle royale genres, influenced by Tekken and Fortnite.
  • Recent surge in fighting games like MultiVersus shows a renaissance in the genre.
  • OutRage promises diverse action with stylized violence inspired by Tekken and chaotic multiplayer like Fortnite.

OutRage: Fight Fest is an exciting new title from developer Hardball Games, and it looks to be a fun mixture of genres. The ambitious multiplayer title brings both brawler and battle royale mechanics together in one experience. Currently in Early Access on Steam, OutRage is a fascinating blend of genres, with Tekken and Fortnite being a huge influence.

There seems to be a new surge in fighting-based games recently. With the release of MultiVersus , as well as Mortal Kombat 1 and Street Fighter 6 being major launches from the past year, the genre is having a bit of a renaissance. Fighting games have been a long-running genre in the industry, and there have been a variety of ways the gameplay has evolved. OutRage promises diverse action that is directly inspired by some of the biggest franchises around.

OutRage Blends Tekken and Fortnite Into One Game

Tekken and Fellow Fighting Franchises Inspire OutRage's Gameplay

Tekken is one of the most popular fighting franchises around, and OutRage has gotten clear inspiration from the series. There are many great entries in the Tekken franchise, and the longevity of the series has inspired many other fighting titles. However, one of the best features of Tekken is its heavily stylized violence that can be gloriously over-the-top.

The absurdity of Tekken 's action is iconic, and it has directly inspired the fighting mechanics of OutRage . The violence in OutRage is cartoonishly fun and stylized, which Tekken does incredibly well. In OutRage , everything in the arena can be used as a weapon, and these objects are used to cause absolute mayhem in matches, bringing classic fighting mechanics a step further. Tekken boasts a variety of great characters, and OutRage has a delightfully diverse roster that has its own unique appearances that call back to the varied characters of classic fighting franchises.

At the time of this writing, there is currently no set release date for OutRage: Fight Fest . However, the Early Access period is expected to last six months.

OutRage Takes Notes From Fortnite's Multiplayer

One of the most interesting aspects of OutRage 's gameplay is that it takes a multiplayer fighting game to the next level. The reveal trailer for the game claims that it's the first "mega brawl" game, as matches can be up to 16 players. The description for OutRage on the game's Steam page puts an emphasis on chaos, which is easy to make happen when 16 players are going head-to-head in an arena. A clear source of inspiration is Fortnite . OutRage has its own version of a battle royale mode, which Fortnite notably helped popularize.

Fortnite may not be the first battle royale title, but it definitely brought the genre to the mainstream, and OutRage has understandably taken note of the popular match mode. Another callback to Fortnite is found in the game's art style. OutRage not only has very stylized violence in the form of Tekken , but the game's overall artwork and character aesthetics are incredibly reminiscent of Fortnite .

As OutRage 's Early Access demo continues to be available on Steam, interested gamers can dive in to see what the massive brawler title is all about. There's no telling what the next big multiplayer title will be, but OutRage has a lot of potential. With the likes of Marvel Rivals also on the horizon, OutRage already has some major competition for an indie title, but its Tekken and Fortnite influences give it a compelling edge.
